Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is to improve the livelihoods of the local population by building and improving social infrastructure. Goldtree (S.L.) Limited will establish a smallholder and outgrower support scheme for the existing 8,000 palm oil farmers and additional new farmers. Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is to establish a foundation called the Goldtree (S.L.) Limited Foundation funded by US$50,000 and 5% of the after-tax profit of Goldtree (S.L.) Limited. The funds of the Goldtree (S.L.) Limited Foundation are to be used to promote Corporate Social Responsibilities including social infrastructure such as the construction and/or rehabilitation of educational, health, water and sanitation, and recreational facilities.

annotations.text: Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is exempted from withholding tax interest payments made by it to other lenders, or by Goldtree (S.L.) Limited to Goldtree Holdings which is then paid to other lenders which are at least 20% directly or indirectly owned by a foreign government and have the provision of development finance in emerging markets as a primary objective. Subject to the provision on withholding tax on rent, Goldtree (S.L.) Limited shall otherwise deduct withholding tax of 5% from other interest payments. Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is entitled to an exemption from deduction of withholding tax on 50% of any dividend paid until 2020, as long as it maintains records of its financial transactions and records relevant to the sale during this period of palm oil and other agricultural products. The remaining 50% of any dividend is to be subject to a withholding tax deduction of 10%. From 01/01/2021, all dividends are subject to a withholding tax of 10%.
annotations.category: Withholding tax on payment of interest and/or dividends

annotations.text: The employees of Goldtree (S.L.) Limited, its contractors and sub-contractors are subject to tax on their locally received income only and shall be taxed on that income at a rate no higher than the same rate applied to employees with the same tax status in Sierra Leone of other local or international companies

The directors, consultants and employees of Goldtree (S.L.) Limited and its contractors and sub-contractors, and their immediate families, are exempt from personal income tax, subject to the general rules on expatriate taxation as defined in the general benefits laid down in the National Investment Incentive legislation for agricultural businesses

annotations.text: Payments of rent by Goldtree (S.L.) Limited in connection with any land lease or rights are allowable deductions for corporate tax purposes and not subject to any withholding tax
Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is entitled to claim tax deductions in respect of depreciation of its capital assets of the project from the date of commencement of commercial operations

All plant, machinery and equipment which are not agricultural inputs are eligible for duty free imports for 5 years of operations.  Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is allowed to elect the applicable 5 year period.
All vehicles which are not agricultural inputs are eligible for duty free imports for 5 years of operations.  Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is allowed to elect the applicable 5 year period.

annotations.text: The Government recognizes Goldtree (S.L.) Limited's entire business as an agricultural enterprise to be granted benefits and incentives at least equivalent to those enjoyed by any other business operating in the agriculture, forestry or bio-energy sectors. Bona fide business payments and expenses of Goldtree (S.L.) Limited are allowable deductions for corporate tax purposes and not subject to any withholding tax as provided in Appendix Art. 9(d).

annotations.text: The project is based on an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment. Goldtree (S.L.) Limited has finalized the technical and environmental studies which confirmed the feasibility of the project from the perspective of soil quality, climate and environmental conditions. The Environmental Licence for the project is to be granted to Goldtree (S.L.) Limited subject to conditions which are typical for an environmental licence, unless there is lawful reason to withhold the licence under the laws of Sierra Leone or if Goldtree (S.L.) Limited's environmental management plan, including the environmental and social impact assessment, is not being implemented to a material extent. Goldtree (S.L.) Limited is to comply with national standards in relation to environmental protection as required for the type of activities carried out under the project or by Goldtree (S.L.) Limited in general.
annotations.category: Social, environmental and/or human rights impact assessments, as well as related management plans

annotations.text: The Government agrees to enter into a water rights agreement with Goldtree (S.L.) Limited. Goldtree (S.L.) Limited will be charged at a fixed rate of 3 Leone per cubic meter of water extracted from rivers and other watercourses. There will be no restriction on the volume of water extracted by Goldtree (S.L.) Limited from rivers, other watercourses, wells and boreholes.

annotations.category: Governing law in case of dispute

annotations.text: Any claim, dispute or difference of any kind between the parties arising out of or in connection with the contract is to be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration in London before three arbitrators under the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce ('ICC'). Each party is to nominate an arbitrator and agree on a third, or else have the third appointed by the other two arbitrators or the ICC Court of Arbitration. The proceedings are to be conducted in the English language. There is no right of appeal to any court on a question of law arising out of an award made in the arbitration. The award is to be final and binding and may be entered in any court with jurisdiction.

annotations.text: The Government agrees to not nationalize, expropriate or confiscate all or any part of the assets or rights of Goldtree (S.L.) Limited, its sub-contractors or their respective contractors or any other party to the documents relevant to the development, operation and funding of the project or the share capital of Goldtree (S.L.) Limited other than on the basis of full compensation to the affected parties

The contract will be given further affect to or implemented in further detail by the Government entering into such further agreements and taking such further action as Goldtree (S.L.) Limited may reasonably request

A breach of the contract by Goldtree (S.L.) Limited or any of its shareholders, contractors, sub-contractors or funders, or by the Government, is not grounds for suspending or terminating the contract. The penalty for such breach is the penalty imposed under Sierra Leone law if the breach is a criminal or civil offence, as well as damages for breach of contract
